intro: Allosorus chaerophyllus, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested. Allosorus chaerophyllus is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as coastal cliffs and rocky slopes.
